    NOTE: RUNNING ALL PARTS OF THIS SCRIPT IS RECOMMENDED FOR ALL MariaDB

    production environment.

    before moving into a production environment.

    will take effect immediately.

    Cleaning up...

    All done!  If you've completed all of the above steps, your MariaDB
    installation should now be secure.

    Thanks for using MariaDB!

# AUTO LOAD COMMAND

# Git
alias ls='ls --color=auto';
alias ll='ls -lh';
alias ld='ll |grep "^d"';
alias psw='ps -a --windows';

alias gs='git status';
alias gad='git add -A';
alias gcm='git commit -m "$comments"';
alias gpushb="git push origin $1";
alias gpullb="git pull origin $1";
alias gcb="git checkout $1";
alias gcc="git checkout cxl";
alias gcm="git checkt master";
alias gb="git branch";
alias gba="git branch -a";
alias gmb="git merge $1";
alias gmm="git merger master";
alias gdf="git diff";
alias gll="git log --graph --abbrev-commit --decorate --all --format=format:'%C(bold blue)%h%C(reset) - %C(bold cyan)%aD%C(dim white) - %an%C(reset) %C(bold green)(%ar)%C(reset)%C(bold yellow)%d%C(reset)%n %C(white)%s%C(reset)";

# FILE
alias ..='cd ..';
alias ....='cd ../../';


# VI/VIM
alias vi='vim';


# .bash_profile
alias sss='source ~/.bash_profile';
alias bash='vim ~/.bash_profile';


# Nginx
alias nginx.start='service nginx start';
alias nginx.stop='nginx -s stop';
alias nginx.process='ps -ef | grep nginx';
alias nginx.reload='nginx -s reload';
alias nginx.kill='pkill -9 nginx';
alias nginx.restart='service nginx restart';

# Win
alias cls='clear';


# Artisan
alias autoload='composer dump-autoload';
alias art.key='php artisan key:generate';
alias migrate='php artisan migrate';
alias route.list='php artisan route:list';


# Laravel-admin
alias admin.install='composer require encore/laravel-admin "1.5.*"';
alias admin.install.2='php artisan vendor:publish --provider="Encore\Admin\AdminServiceProvider" && php artisan admin:install';
alias admin.helper='composer require laravel-admin-ext/helpers && php artisan admin:import helpers';

æ³¨å†ŒæˆæœåŠ¡è„šæœ¬ å…ˆåˆ›å»ºæ–‡ä»¶/etc/init.d/nginx å†…å®¹ä¸º:

#!/bin/sh
# chkconfig: 2345 85 15
# description:Nginx Server

NGINX_HOME=/usr/local/nginx
NGINX_SBIN=$NGINX_HOME/sbin/nginx
NGINX_CONF=$NGINX_HOME/conf/nginx.conf
NGINX_PID=$NGINX_HOME/logs/nginx.pid

NGINX_NAME=â€œNginxâ€

. /etc/rc.d/init.d/functions

if [ ! -f $NGINX_SBIN ]
then
echo "$NGINX_NAME startup: $NGINX_SBIN not exists! "
exit
fi

start() {
$NGINX_SBIN -c $NGINX_CONF
ret=$?
if [ $ret -eq 0 ]; then
action $"Starting $NGINX_NAME: " /bin/true
else
action $"Starting $NGINX_NAME: " /bin/false
fi
}

stop() {
kill `cat $NGINX_PID`
ret=$?
if [ $ret -eq 0 ]; then
action $"Stopping $NGINX_NAME: " /bin/true
else
action $"Stopping $NGINX_NAME: " /bin/false
fi
}

restart() {
stop
start
}

check() {
$NGINX_SBIN -c $NGINX_CONF -t
}

reload() {
kill -HUP `cat $NGINX_PID` && echo â€œreload success!â€
}

relog() {
kill -USR1 `cat $NGINX_PID` && echo â€œrelog success!â€
}

case â€œ$1â€ in
start)
start
;;
stop)
stop
;;
restart)
restart
;;
check|chk)
check
;;
status)
status -p $NGINX_PID
;;
reload)
reload
;;
relog)
relog
;;
*)
echo $â€œUsage: $0 {start|stop|restart|reload|status|check|relog}â€
exit 1
esac

â¡ï¸Options
Name,shorthand Default Description
â€“add-host Add a custom host-to-IP mapping (host:ip)
â€“attach , -a Attach to STDIN, STDOUT or STDERR
â€“blkio-weight Block IO (relative weight), between 10 and 1000, or 0 to disable (default 0)

â€“cap-add Add Linux capabilities
â€“cap-drop Drop Linux capabilities
â€“cgroup-parent Optional parent cgroup for the container
â€“cidfile Write the container ID to the file
â€“cpu-count CPU count (Windows only)
â€“cpu-percent CPU percent (Windows only)
â€“cpu-period Limit CPU CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler) period
â€“cpu-quota Limit CPU CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler) quota
â€“cpu-rt-period API 1.25+
Limit CPU real-time period in microseconds
â€“cpu-rt-runtime API 1.25+
Limit CPU real-time runtime in microseconds
â€“cpu-shares , -c CPU shares (relative weight)
â€“cpus API 1.25+
Number of CPUs
â€“cpuset-cpus CPUs in which to allow execution (0-3, 0,1)
â€“cpuset-mems MEMs in which to allow execution (0-3, 0,1)
â€“device Add a host device to the container
â€“device-cgroup-rule Add a rule to the cgroup allowed devices list
â€“device-read-bps Limit read rate (bytes per second) from a device
â€“device-read-iops Limit read rate (IO per second) from a device
â€“device-write-bps Limit write rate (bytes per second) to a device
â€“device-write-iops Limit write rate (IO per second) to a device
â€“disable-content-trust true Skip image verification
â€“dns Set custom DNS servers
â€“dns-opt Set DNS options
â€“dns-option Set DNS options
â€“dns-search Set custom DNS search domains
â€“domainname Container NIS domain name
â€“entrypoint Overwrite the default ENTRYPOINT of the image
â€“env , -e Set environment variables
â€“env-file Read in a file of environment variables
â€“expose Expose a port or a range of ports
â€“gpus API 1.40+
GPU devices to add to the container (â€˜allâ€™ to pass all GPUs)
â€“group-add Add additional groups to join
â€“health-cmd Command to run to check health
â€“health-interval Time between running the check (msä¸¨sä¸¨mä¸¨h) (default 0s)
â€“health-retries Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy
â€“health-start-period API 1.29+

â€“health-timeout Maximum time to allow one check to run (msä¸¨sä¸¨mä¸¨h) (default 0s)
â€“help Print usage
â€“hostname , -h Container host name
â€“init API 1.25+
Run an init inside the container that forwards signals and reaps processes
â€“interactive , -i Keep STDIN open even if not attached
â€“io-maxbandwidth Maximum IO bandwidth limit for the system drive (Windows only)

â€“ip IPv4 address (e.g., 172.30.100.104)

â€“ipc IPC mode to use
â€“isolation Container isolation technology
â€“kernel-memory Kernel memory limit
â€“label , -l Set meta data on a container

â¡ï¸.gitkeep æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆç”¨ ?

â€œ.gitkeepâ€ isnâ€™t documented, because itâ€™s not a feature of Git.
Git cannot add a completely empty directory. People who want to track empty directories in Git have created the convention of putting files called â€œ.gitkeepâ€ in these directories. The file could be called anything; Git assigns no special significance to this name.
There is a competing convention of adding a â€œ.gitignoreâ€ file to the empty directories to get them tracked, but some people see this as confusing since the goal is to keep the empty directories, not ignore them; â€œ.gitignoreâ€ is also used to list files that should be ignored by Git when looking for untracked files.
or you can use like this to except for this one: !.gitignore.
